result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A Maples was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
STRAIGHT TIME. 
1 day credit, if revoked.
Court authorizes early termination after 9 months upon recommendation of the Agent.

miscConds.notes: Maintain/obtain full time employment and/or schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol, other than a grocery store. (no bars, taverns, or liquor stores)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A Maples

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated 
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jeffrey A Maples in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

60 Days Jail Straight Time (Credit 1 day)

Term of Probation: 1 Year  Court will authorize early termination after 9 months upon recommendation of the agent,

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment and or schooling;
- No violent contact with any family member
 - Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.


Costs: $343.00
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Amy C Scholz in court.   Defendant Jeffrey A Maples did not appear.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney appears by authorization. This case is going to resolve and Defense requests a date in 30 days. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Amy C Scholz in court.   Defendant Jeffrey A Maples did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Defense was waiting for discovery and has now received it and needs to discuss this matter with her client. Defense requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Amy C Scholz in court.   Defendant Jeffrey A Maples did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.  Defense is still waiting for Discovery and requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Jeffrey A Maples in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.
